properties.entry: Never Reported - In system less than 4 days

The Delta Usage graph is a view of the usage data as the delta between intervals.

Each point on the graph is generated using the following formula: (reading - previousReading) / (days between readings). If gaps in data exist that are greater than the charted interval, then that interval will be removed from the display.

The Delta Usage graph is a view of the usage data as the delta between intervals.

Each point on the graph is generated using the following formula: (reading - previousReading) / (days between readings). If gaps in data exist that are greater than the charted interval, then that interval will be removed from the display.

The Daily Usage graph is a normalized view of daily usage data.

Each point on the graph is generated using the midnight readings only with the following formula: (reading - previousReading) / (days between readings)

The Normalized Usage graph is a normalized view of the usage data.

Each point on the graph is generated using the following formula: (reading - previousReading) / (days between readings)
Graph of Delivered kWh per Interval data.
Graph of Delivered kW Load Profile data.
Graph of Sum kWh per Interval data.
Graph of Sum kW Load Profile data.

Authentication, Active Directory, LDAP server settings
Data import and export settings, schedule options, and billing format settings
Vendor info, device mapping, billing groups
Voice server call prefix, call response time
Opt outs, importing, switch command settings
Add weather tracking locations to Yukon
Demand Response Encrypted Routes and Keys
Determines whether new opt outs count against the opt out limits.
System default time zone (e.g. America/Denver, America/Chicago, America/Los_Angeles, or America/New_York).
File location of the automated consumer information import process.
The number of hours that an alert should be held (zero = forever, decimal numbers are okay).
Defines the format for displaying devices. Available placeholders: DEVICE_NAME, METER_NUMBER
When true, excludes disabled meters from initiated read, ping, and control requests and from supported meters requests.
The data attribute field used to lookup a meter in Yukon.

The MultiSpeak field used to manage location coordinates. None - disable updating coordinates through MultiSpeak; Meter - update coordinates based off Meter object; Service Location - update coordinates based of ServiceLocation object.
Controls access to setup the MultiSpeak LM interface mappings.
The Device Group parent group name for the MultiSpeak billingCycle element. Valid values are '/Meters/Billing/', '/Meters/Collection', '/Meters/Alternate'.
The primary CIS vendor for CB_Server interfaces. Used for CIS Account Information widget and Meter Search functionality.
The MultiSpeak field used to set the Yukon Device Name data for meter management.
The MultiSpeak field extension name to be appended to Device Name Alias. Leave this value blank to ignore the use of extensions.
Force Read for OD Ping (RFN Only)
Force an attribute read for RFN meter types, otherwise latest archived outage status will be used.
When true, disable the meters in initiateDisconnectStatus request or enable the meters in cancelDisconnectStatus request.
Remove Device From CIS Device Group(s)
When true, remove device from CIS Device Group(s) upon meter remove processing; i.e. /Meters/Billing, /Meters/Alternate, /Meters/CIS Substation.
Defines the type of CIS Information widget to display.
Rounding Mode used when formatting value data in billing formats. Available placeholders: HALF_EVEN, CEILING, FLOOR, UP, DOWN, HALF_DOWN, HALF_UP.
Comma separated list of file extensions allowed to override the default file extension for scheduled reports.
Comma separated list of directories that can be selected for scheduled file import.
Comma separated list of directories allowed to select for exporting a scheduled report to.

The number of days to save archived files from Yukon operations. Archived files older than this will be deleted. Select 0 to keep files forever. This is used by actions that keep historical file records for a time period such as Import and Export History and Collection Actions Results.

The maximum number of archived files to keep per export schedule. Any additional files for a given schedule will be deleted. Select 0 to keep all files. (Requires Export History Archive File Deletion Maintenance task to be enabled.)
CADP format requires a coop id number.
Remove the multiplier value from the reading.
Integer value for number of days for energy readings to query back from billing end date.
Integer value for number of days for demand readings to query back from billing end date.
The Default file formats. See table BillingFileFormats.format for other valid values.
c:\yukon\client\bin\BillingIn.txt,Directory to read billing input file from. Used by ExtendedTOU_Incode, MVRS, WLT_40, and NCDC_Handhed formats.
Any number or numbers that must be dialed before a call can be placed.
The number of seconds to wait for a confirmation from the time the call is initiated until the user listens to the notification.
Controls access to password recovery (Forgot your password?) feature.
Active Directory Server Port. A space separated list of ports can be provided for failover. These must directly correspond to the AD Server Address list ordering.
Active Directory Server Address. A space separated list of addresses can be provided for failover.
Controls the encryption type used for the Active Directory connection.
Choose which credentials are remembered by Yukon Applications. Credentials are encrypted and saved on your computer in a manner that is difficult but not impossible for an intruder to read.
Controls the encryption type used for the LDAP connection.
Default authentication type, possible values: Active Directory, Encrypted, LDAP, Radius, No Login.
Number of seconds before the authentication process times out.
Client machine secret key value, defined by the server.
Specifies whether communications will be allowed by the bulk importer.
Specifies whether the STARS application should automatically process batched switch commands.
Name or IP address of the Network Manager web server.
Name or IP address of the RFN Firmware update server.
Name of the update server user.
RFN Firmware Update Server User Password
Password of the update server user.
The logo that is used for the yukon web applications.
Controls whether the STARS application should preload data into the cache.
Name of the FROM email address the mail server will use.
Name or IP address of Yukon Message Broker Service. Requires Message Broker, Web Server, Service Manager, and any running Yukon Applications to restart for changes to take effect.

TCP Port of Yukon Message Broker Service. Defaults to 61616 if left blank. Requires Message Broker, Web Server, Service Manager, and any running Yukon Applications to restart for changes to take effect.
Name or IP address of the mail server.
TCP/IP port of the mail server.
The encryption to be used with SMTP connection.
Directory to save generated web graph images.
Interval at which to generate web graphs.
Number of past months available for trending data.
Maximum number of readings retrieved and displayed per point. (Use 0 for unlimited.)
Turn on Google analytics for the web server.
The tracking ID that google analytics will use.
The base URL used to generate links to Yukon web pages in emails and other external communications.
The URL of the web server, to be used by other Yukon services. This should be set when the Yukon External URL does not resolve or is not usable from the internal network where Yukon is installed.
The number of milliseconds between OpenADR pull requests.
The unique identifier of the VEN.
The unique identifier of the VTN.
The URL of the OpenADR VTN.
The complete path of the keystore file which contains the VEN certificate.
The complete path of the truststore file which contains the VTN certificate.
The maximum number of distribute events to receive from the VTN. (No limit if 0.)
The certificate thumbprint of the VTN.
The Yukon User for which the load management requests will be executed.
The duration to be used for open-ended control events, specified by a number and a character indicating weeks, days, hours, or minutes (i.e. "1.5d").
File location of the database migration export process.
The time period to be used for temporary device group deletion.
System wide HTTP proxy settings. Used to facilitate HTTP requests which require a proxy server. (values = ip:port)
Email address displayed in the 'Contact Us' section of login page.
Phone number displayed in the 'Contact Us' section of login page.
Maximum number of hours since last communication with device.
Maximum number of hours since last runtime from device.
Enables the RF broadcast performance feature for demand response messaging.
Username to authenticate with the ecobee service.
Password to authenticate with the ecobee service.
URL to connect to the ecobee service.
Enables/Disables notifications being sent by ecobee when a DR request is made through Yukon.
Connection string for the Honeywell wifi service bus.
Queue name for the Honeywell wifi service bus.
The maximum number of hours a scheduled request may run before automatically being cancelled.
URL to connect to Honeywell service.
ApplicationId issued along with clientId from Honeywell service.
ClientId to get access token from Honeywell service.
Secret to get access token from Honeywell service.
URL to connect to the Nest service.
Username to authenticate with the Nest service.
Password to authenticate with the Nest service.
URL to connect to the Itron HCM service.
Username to authenticate with the Itron HCM service.
Password to authenticate with the Itron HCM service.
The interval, in hours, at which to request data from the Itron HCM service if there are Itron devices created in Yukon.
Domain (and port, if non-standard) to connect to the Itron SFTP service.
Username to authenticate with the Itron SFTP service.
Password to authenticate with the Itron SFTP service.
Optional password to encrypt the generated SFTP Private Key.

The size, in kilobytes, of messages that a producer can send before it is blocked to await a ProducerAck from the broker that frees enough memory to allow another message to be sent. (Requires restart to take effect.)
The time, in seconds, of inactivity before the service connection is reset. (Requires restart to take effect.)
The size limit, in gigabytes, of individual service log files.
The number of days to retain archived log files. Archived log files older than this will be deleted. Select 0 to keep files forever.
When true, pages supporting system data collection will display an option for the user to initiate a debug report to the log files.
When true, location coordinates are retained following remove, disable, or return to warehouse action. Otherwise they are deleted.
Incoming RFN data having timestamps older than this number (in months) will not be processed nor archived.
Incoming point data having timestamps older than this number (in days) will not be processed nor published to OMS Vendors. A value of 0 will process all data.
Window for minimum number of days required for a device's data to be considered available.
Infrastructure Warnings: Gateway connection warning minutes
The number of minutes a gateway must be disconnected to generate a warning.
Infrastructure Warnings: Gateway connected nodes warning threshold
The number of connected nodes a gateway must have to generate a warning.
Infrastructure Warnings: Gateway connected nodes critical threshold
The number of connected nodes a gateway must have to generate a critical warning.
Infrastructure Warnings: Gateway ready nodes threshold
The maximum number of ready nodes a gateway must have to generate a warning.
Comm Channel Queue Counts: Historical data display
The number of months to display historical data for the Comm Channel Queue Counts Widget.
Comm Channel Queue Counts: Maximum number of comm channels
The maximum number of comm channels to be displayed in one Comm Channel Queue Counts Widget.
Comm Channel Queue Counts: Minutes to wait before data refresh
The number of minutes to wait before data can be refreshed for a given Comm Channel Queue Counts Widget.
Host name to connect to network manager Database
User ID for network manager Database
Sender address of emails sent on behalf of energy company, e.g. control odds and opt out notification emails.
Specifies the number of account number characters to consider for comparison purposes during the customer account import process.
Enables the use of alternate program enrollments.
The name of the set of CICustomerPointData TYPES that should be set for customers.
Automatically create a login for the primary contact on a STARS account.
Auto create login for additional contacts
Automatically create a default login for each additional contact created on a STARS account.
Enables you to enroll in multiple programs within an appliance category.
Controls whether to perform inventory checking while creating or updating hardware information.
Allow creation of inventory if not found during Inventory Checking.
Controls whether the call number is automatically generated or entered by user. Value may be true (start at 0) or the number to actually start with.
Controls whether the work order number is automatically generated or entered by user.
Specifies the number of rotation digit characters to ignore during the customer account import process.
Allow the use of 5/1/1 schedules for compatible thermostats. Weekday/Saturday/Sunday.
Allow the use of 5/2 day schedules for compatible thermostats. Weekday/Weekend.
Allow the use of 7 day schedules for compatible thermostats. Different schedule each day of the week.
Allow the use of weekly schedules for compatible thermostats. One schedule for the entire week.
Toggles on or off the regional (usually zip) code option for service companies.
Controls whether to automatically send out config command when creating hardware or changing program enrollment.
Broadcast Cancel All Opt Out SPID
Which SPID to use when sending the broadcast cancel all opt out command.
Default temperature unit for an energy company, F(ahrenheit) or C(elsius)
Default time zone of the energy company. (e.g. America/Denver, America/Chicago, America/Los_Angeles, or America/New_York)
If part of a member structure, should appliance categories be inherited from the parent.
Comma separated list of email addresses. Recipients of the Opt Out notification email.
Treat serial numbers as numeric or alphanumeric. Possible values (Numeric, Alphanumeric)
Indicates whether this is a single energy company system.
Suppress In and Out Of Service messages
When true, suppresses In and Out of Service messages.
Controls whether to track the hardware addressing information.
This feature is for development purposes only
Days of the week for general business hours. During this time window, Yukon maintenance tasks will not be started.
Days of the week when external maintenance tasks, such as database backups, are scheduled to start. During this time window, Yukon maintenance tasks will not be started.
Start and Stop times of the Business Days.
Start and Stop times of the External Maintenance Days.
